FbDMDÂ¶

Derived module from dmdbase.py for forward/backward dmd.

FbDMD.atilde Get the reduced Koopman operator A, called A tilde.
FbDMD.dmd_timesteps Get the timesteps of the reconstructed states.
FbDMD.dynamics Get the time evolution of each mode.
FbDMD.eigs Get the eigenvalues of A tilde.
FbDMD.fit Compute the Dynamics Modes Decomposition to the input data.
FbDMD.modes Get the matrix containing the DMD modes, stored by column.
FbDMD.original_timesteps Get the timesteps of the original snapshot.
FbDMD.plot_eigs Plot the eigenvalues.
FbDMD.plot_modes_2D Plot the DMD Modes.
FbDMD.plot_snapshots_2D Plot the snapshots.
FbDMD.reconstructed_data Get the reconstructed data.
FbDMD.snapshots Get the original input data.
class FbDMD(svd_rank=0, tlsq_rank=0, exact=False, opt=False)[source]

Bases: pydmd.dmdbase.DMDBase

Forward/backward DMD class.

Parameters:
  • svd_rank (int or float) – the rank for the truncation; If 0, the method computes the optimal rank and uses it for truncation; if positive interger, the method uses the argument for the truncation; if float between 0 and 1, the rank is the number of the biggest singular values that are needed to reach the ‘energy’ specified by svd_rank; if -1, the method does not compute truncation.
  • tlsq_rank (int) – rank truncation computing Total Least Square. Default is 0, that means TLSQ is not applied.
  • exact (bool) – flag to compute either exact DMD or projected DMD. Default is False.
  • opt (bool) – flag to compute optimal amplitudes. See DMDBase. Default is False.

Reference: Dawson et al. https://arxiv.org/abs/1507.02264

fit(X)[source]

Compute the Dynamics Modes Decomposition to the input data.

Parameters:X (numpy.ndarray or iterable) – the input snapshots.
